reviews.review_msg: Reema is a kind person and is always open/asks for feedback. there were quite a few papers on top of weekly readings but overall course material was interesting and she gave grace periods for all assignments. she also gives guides for the weekly readings and viewings which are helpful to understand the course content

My favourite prof I have had so far at SFU. She has very interactive lectures that work to really engage students. She asks for feedback on her classes and makes sure each topic is understood through videos, group activities, reflections, etc.

Reema is very organized, yet flexible to pivot in response to student needs. Her assigned readings are always interesting. She really cares about student's learning experience. I loved this class and will hopefully get a chance to take more with Reema

I did not receive a grade higher than 78% no matter how nice she was with the comments, she expected as if we had to master the art of know-it-all. her comments are very confusing, and i hate that she is never clear on what she wants, I will never retake her.

Literally love Dr. Faris so much! I have had about 4 or 5 classes with her as they often fit into my schedule the best. She is always so wonderful and the topics are so interesting. Lots of special topic courses so keep an eye out for possible classes and the title as they change often. She is amazing at giving in depth feedback.

Reema is a great professor. Lectures are open to discussion regarding how much emphasis is put on a certain point; I believe this is incredibly important to do as a teacher: let your students say what they need to say, and get what they need to get from the lecture. The readings were interesting and I looked forward to this class.

I regret taking her class. Her lesson plans are mixed up. she gives 10 minutes break to students than she herself her 5 min cant control herself to start the class even though she is seeing the students are eating. Also attendence is super mandatory, she hates students who does not go to her class and end up giving them 0.
